background.description: Background colour of box. Solid white if not specified.

inactive.description: Prevents an interactive component from being interacted with and applies accessibility attributes to indicate to the user that this component cannot be used.

inverted.description: Use inverted buttons on darker backgrounds.

pressed.description: Applies while an interactive component is being physically pressed. Most visible on touchscreen taps; in React Native Web, this is visible on web mouse clicks only if the pressable is held down.

rank.description: Prominence of the button. Secondary buttons are less eye-catching, for lower priority actions. Alternative buttons are the same as primary default buttons with a different hover colour.

selected.description: Applies while an interactive component is the currently selected one in a set of states or components, for example a button in a `ButtonGroup`.

inactive.description: Prevents an interactive component from being interacted with and applies accessibility attributes to indicate to the user that this component cannot be used.

open.description: Applies when a ButtonDropdown is open.

pressed.description: Applies while an interactive component is being physically pressed. Most visible on touchscreen taps; in React Native Web, this is visible on web mouse clicks only if the pressable is held down.

selected.description: Applies while an interactive component is the currently selected one in a set of states or components, for example a button in a `ButtonGroup`.

selected.description: Applies while an interactive component is the currently selected one in a set of states or components, for example a button in a `ButtonGroup`.

viewport.description: The size label for the current screen viewport based on the current screen width

bold.description: Styles the link as bold text. Does not affect any accessibility properties.

compact.description: Reduces line height on some body text styles. For data-rich content, not for flow content

size.description: Text sizes for block links; similar but not always identical to Typography sizes.

maxWidth.description: Whether a modal should expand responsively to the maximum of 8 layout columns width
